Showing all the commands that are required for any <span style=" color: #404040; font-family:&quot;Trebuchet MS&quot;, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">naïve user </span>to understand the basics of <span style=" color: #404040; font-family:&quot;Trebuchet MS&quot;, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">Apache HIVE</span>.</p><p style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This project is being followed from the initialization process of</p><p style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: left;">starting <span style=" color: #404040; font-family:&quot;Trebuchet MS&quot;, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">HIVE </span>containers to handle large dataset (having size of <span style=" color: #404040; font-family:&quot;Trebuchet MS&quot;, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">7 GB</span>), each command has been delivered with a complete explanation.</p><p style="text-indent: justify;">Explanation: Now, all the containers are being networked together under a bridge name docker-hive_default, we can use our Airlines Big Data to load on HIVE and HDFS and work with HiveSQL.</p><h2 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Basic Guide of Apache Hive</h2><ol id="l4"><li data-list-text="1."><h3 style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 86pt;text-indent: -14pt;text-align: left;">Understanding Data Types</h3><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">docker cp </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">employee.txt </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">docker-hive_hive-server_1:/</span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">home</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Copy the employee.txt file from local computer and pasting it to HIVE container.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">docker-compose exec </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">hive-server bash</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Starting HIVE container and entering in bash environment.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 121pt;text-indent: -49pt;text-align: justify;"><span style=" color: #C00000;">Important</span><span class="s33">: </span>In-case the above command is not taking you in bash environment, then you must restart container using <span style=" color: #528135;">docker-compose restart </span>command and be sure to check that you must be in <span style=" color: #528135;">docker-hive (where yml exist) </span>folder while running any of the compose commands.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">hadoop fs -put -</span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">f /home/employee.txt /user/</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Copy <span style=" color: #528135;">employee.txt </span>file from HIVE Container to <span style=" color: #528135;">HDFS</span>.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 22pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">cat </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: left;">Drop the database.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Explanation: The above command gets failed when database is not empty.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS </span>myhivebook CASCADE<span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Drop the database with tables.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Explanation: The above commands drop database and along with its tables.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s28" style="padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000;">alter database </span>myhivebook <span style=" color: #008000;">set </span>dbproperties (<span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;edited-by&#39;</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">=</span><span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;fareed&#39;</span>); <span style=" color: #008000;">alter database </span>myhivebook <span style=" color: #008000;">set owner user </span>fareed;</p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 10pt;text-align: left;">alter database <span style=" color: #333;">myhivebook </span>set location <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;/tmp/data/myhivebook&#39;</span><span style=" color: #333;">;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Alter the database properties. The <span style=" color: #528135;">ALTER DATABASE </span>statement can only apply to <span style=" color: #528135;">dbproperties</span>, owner, and <span style=" color: #528135;">location </span>on the <span style=" color: #528135;">database</span>. The other <span style=" color: #528135;">database </span>properties cannot be changed</p></li><li data-list-text="3."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 88pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Tables</h3><p style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 22pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">cat </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">/home/employee.txt</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 74pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Printing the content of <span style=" color: #528135;">employee.txt</span>.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s20" style="padding-top: 5pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: right;">Output:</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s35" style="padding-left: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 111%;text-align: left;">Michael|Montreal,Toronto|Male,30|DB:80|Product:Developer^DLead Will|Montreal|Male,35|Perl:85|Product:Lead,Test:Lead</p><p class="s35" style="padding-left: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Shelley|New York|Female,27|Python:80|Test:Lead,COE:Architect</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s29" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">CREATE TABLE <span style=" color: #333;">IF </span>NOT EXISTS <span style=" color: #333;">employee_internal (</span></p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 17pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">name STRING <span style=" color: #008000;">COMMENT </span><span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;this is optinal column comments&#39;</span>,</p><p class="s28" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">work_place <span style=" color: #008000;">ARRAY</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>STRING<span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;</span>,</p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;">gender_age STRUCT<span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>gender:STRING,age:<span style=" color: #008000;">INT</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;</span>, skills_score <span style=" color: #008000;">MAP</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>STRING,<span style=" color: #008000;">INT</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;</span>,</p><p class="s28" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 10pt;text-align: left;">depart_title <span style=" color: #008000;">MAP</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>STRING,<span style=" color: #008000;">ARRAY</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>STRING<span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;&gt;</span></p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">)</p><p class="s29" style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 117%;text-align: left;">COMMENT <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;This is an internal table&#39; </span>ROW <span style=" color: #333;">FORMAT DELIMITED</span></p><p class="s29" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333;">FIELDS TERMINATED </span>BY <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;|&#39; </span><span style=" color: #333;">COLLECTION ITEMS TERMINATED </span>BY <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;,&#39; </span>MAP <span style=" color: #333;">KEYS TERMINATED </span>BY <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;:&#39;</span></p><p class="s28" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 10pt;text-align: left;">STORED <span style=" color: #008000;">as </span>TEXTFILE;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- table column names are NOT case sensitive</span></p><p style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- columns names are lower case</span></p><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- No &quot;,&quot; for the last column</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- This is optional table comments</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- Symbol to seperate columns</span></p><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- Seperate collection elements</span></p><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- Symbol to seperate keys and values</span></p><p style="padding-top: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- Table file format</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create an Internal table.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Explanation: It is the default table in Hive. When the user creates a table in Hive without specifying it as external, then by default, an internal table gets created in a specific location in HDFS.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 22pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE <span style=" color: #333;">employee_external ( </span><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- Use EXTERNAL keywords</span></p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">name string,</p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">work_place <span style=" color: #008000;">ARRAY</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>string<span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;</span>,</p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 117%;text-align: left;">gender_age STRUCT<span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>gender:string,age:<span style=" color: #008000;">int</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;</span>, skills_score <span style=" color: #008000;">MAP</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>string,<span style=" color: #008000;">int</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;</span>,</p><p class="s28" style="padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">depart_title <span style=" color: #008000;">MAP</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>STRING,<span style=" color: #008000;">ARRAY</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&lt;</span>STRING<span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">&gt;&gt;</span></p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">)</p><p class="s29" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;">ROW <span style=" color: #333;">FORMAT DELIMITED FIELDS TERMINATED </span>BY <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;|&#39; </span><span style=" color: #333;">COLLECTION ITEMS TERMINATED </span>BY <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;,&#39;</span></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 117%;text-align: left;">MAP <span style=" color: #333;">KEYS TERMINATED </span>BY <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;:&#39; </span><span style=" color: #333;">STORED </span>as <span style=" color: #333;">TEXTFILE</span></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 33pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 11pt;text-align: left;">LOCATION <span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;/user/myexternaldata/employee&#39;</span><span style=" color: #333;">; </span><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9.5pt;">-- data folder location</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create an external table.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Explanation: We create an external table when we want to use the data outside the Hive. Whenever we drop the external table, then only the metadata associated with the table will get deleted, the table data remains untouched by Hive.</p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">IF </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">NOT EXISTS </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">tmp_emp1 (</span></p><p style="padding-left: 35pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">name string,</span></p><p style="padding-left: 35pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">work_place </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">ARRAY</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">string</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&gt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">,</span></p><p style="padding-left: 35pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 106%;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">gender_age STRUCT</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">gender:string,age:</span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">int</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&gt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">, skills_score </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">MAP</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">string,</span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">int</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&gt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">,</span></p><p style="padding-left: 35pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">depart_title </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">MAP</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">STRING,</span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">ARRAY</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">STRING</span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">&gt;&gt;</span></p><p style="padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">);</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create a temporary table.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Explanation: A temporary table is only visible to the current user session. It&#39;s automatically deleted at the end of the session. The data of the temporary table is stored in the user&#39;s scratch directory, such as /tmp/hive-&lt;username&gt;.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE </span>tmp_emp2 <span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">as SELECT * FROM </span>tmp_emp1;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create a temporary table <span style=" color: #808080;">(second way)</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE </span>tmp_emp3 <span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">like </span>tmp_emp1;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create a temporary table <span style=" color: #808080;">(third way)</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;">Tables can also be created and populated by the results of a query in one statement, called Create-Table-As-Select (CTAS). CTAS has the restrictions that it cannot be a partitioned table, external table, or a list-bucketing table.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">CREATE TABLE </span>ctas_employee <span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">as SELECT * FROM </span>employee_external<span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Create a table with CTAS</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 30pt;text-indent: -3pt;line-height: 119%;text-align: left;">CREATE TABLE <span style=" color: #333;">cte_employee </span>AS WITH <span style=" color: #333;">r1 </span>AS <span style=" color: #333;">(</span>SELECT <span style=" color: #333;">name</span></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 32pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 10pt;text-align: left;">FROM <span style=" color: #333;">r2</span></p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 32pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000;">WHERE </span>name <span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 9pt;">= </span><span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;Michael&#39; </span>),</p><p class="s28" style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 89pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">r2 <span style=" color: left;">Displaying a table after truncating it.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s46" style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: 0pt;text-align: left;">ALTER TABLE <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">cte_employee </span>RENAME TO <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">cte_employee_backup;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Rename a table with the <span style=" color: #528135;">ALTER </span>statement.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s37" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 22pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ALTER TABLE <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">employee </span>SET TBLPROPERTIES <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">(&#39;comment&#39;=&#39;New comments&#39;);</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Change the table properties with <span style=" color: #528135;">TBLPROPERTIES </span>command.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s37" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 22pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">ALTER TABLE <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">employee SET </span>FILEFORMAT <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">RCFILE;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Change the table&#39;s file format with <span style=" color: #528135;">FILEFORMAT </span>command<span class="s40">.</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><ol id="l10"><li data-list-text="1."><p class="s50" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 36pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">ALTER TABLE employee <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">ENABLE NO_DROP;</span></p></li><li data-list-text="2."><p class="s50" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 36pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">ALTER TABLE employee <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">DISABLE NO_DROP;</span></p></li></ol><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Enable/Disable the <span style=" color: #528135;">NO_DROP </span>prevents a table from being dropped.</p><ol id="l11"><li data-list-text="1."><p class="s50" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 36pt;text-indent: ALTER TABLE </span>employee_partitioned <span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">PARTITION (year=2018) CONCATENATE;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: left;">Changing the partition&#39;s other properties in terms of file format, location, protections, and concatenation have the same syntax to alter the table statement.</p></li><li data-list-text="5."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 88pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Buckets</h3><p style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Besides partition, the bucket is another technique to cluster datasets into more manageable parts to optimize query performance. Different from a partition, a bucket corresponds to segments of files in HDFS.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">docker cp </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">employee_id.txt </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">docker-hive_hive-server_1:/</span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">home</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Copy the employee_id.txt file from local computer and pasting it to HIVE container.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">docker-compose exec </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">hive-server bash</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Starting HIVE container and entering in bash environment.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 121pt;text-indent: -49pt;text-align: justify;"><span style=" color: #C00000;">Important</span><span class="s33">: </span>In-case the above command is not taking you in bash environment, then you must restart container using <span style=" color: #528135;">docker-compose restart </span>command and be sure to check that you must be in <span style=" color: #528135;">docker-hive (where yml exist) </span>folder while running any of the style="padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Explanation: Two buckets are created inside HDFS shell.</p></li><li data-list-text="6."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 88pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Views</h3><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Views are logical data structures that can be used to simplify queries by hiding the complexities, such as joins, subqueries, and filters.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 49pt;text-indent: -22pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;">CREATE VIEW <span style=" color: #333;">IF </span>NOT EXISTS <span style=" color: #333;">employee_skills </span>AS SELECT</p><p class="s28" style="padding-left: 67pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 118%;text-align: left;">name, skills_score[<span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;DB&#39;</span>] <span style=" color: #008000;">as </span>DB, skills_score[<span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;Perl&#39;</span>] <span style=" color: #008000;">as </span>Perl, skills_score[<span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;Python&#39;</span>] <span style=" color: #008000;">as </span>Python, skills_score[<span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;Sales&#39;</span>] <span style=" color: #008000;">as </span>Sales, skills_score[<span style=" color: #B92020;">&#39;HR&#39;</span>] <span style=" color: #008000;">as </span>HR</p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 49pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">FROM <span style=" color: #333;">employee_id;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Creating a VIEW from <span style=" color: #528135;">employee_id </span>table.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: left;">Explanation: When creating views, there is no yarn job triggered since this is only a metadata change. However, the job will be triggered when querying the view.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 18pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: class="s20" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Output:</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s39" style="padding-left: 78pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Execution Time: (0.0121 seconds)</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Explanation: It is usually used with user-defined table-generating functions in Hive, for data normalization or processing JSON data. LateralView first applies the table-generation function to the data, and then joins the function&#39;s input and output together.</p></li><li data-list-text="7."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 87pt;text-indent: -15pt;text-align: left;">Performance Utilities</h3><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">HQL provides the <span style=" color: #528135;">EXPLAIN </span>and <span style=" color: #528135;">ANALYZE </span>statements, which can be used as utilities to check and identify the performance of queries.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Hive provides an <span style=" color: #528135;">EXPLAIN </span>statement to return a query execution plan without running the query. We can use it to analyse queries if we have concerns about their performance. The <span style=" color: #528135;">EXPLAIN </span>statement helps us to see the difference between two or more queries for the same purpose.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 155%;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">EXPLAIN SELECT </span>gender_age.gender, count(*) <span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">FROM employee_partitioned WHERE year=2018 GROUP BY </span>gender_age.gender LIMIT 2<span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s34" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">EXPLAIN <span style=" color: #404040;">statement overview</span>.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s20" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Output:</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="width:311pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#BEBEBE;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#BEBEBE;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#BEBEBE;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#BEBEBE" 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s39" style="padding-left: 78pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Execution Time: (0.0711 seconds)</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Explanation: We can see that the AST section is shown as a Map/Reduce operator tree. In the STAGE DEPENDENCIES section, both Stage-0 and Stage-1 are independent root stages. In the STAGE PLANS section, Stage-1 has one map and reduce referred to by the Map Operator Tree and Reduce Operator Tree.</p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Inside each Map/Reduce Operator Tree section, all operators corresponding to the query keywords, as well as expressions and aggregations, are listed. The Stage-0 stage does not have map and reduce. It is just a Fetch operation</p><p style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Hive statistics are a collection of data that describes more details, such as the number of rows, number of files, and raw data size of the objects in the database. Statistics are the metadata of data, collected and stored in the metastore database.</p><p style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">The statistics are gathered manually through the <span style=" color: #528135;">ANALYZE </span>statement on <span style=" color: #528135;">tables, partitions, and columns</span>.</p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">ANALYZE TABLE </span>employee COMPUTE STATISTICS;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Collect statistics on the existing table.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">ANALYZE TABLE </span>employee COMPUTE STATISTICS <span class="s34">NOSCAN</span>;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Collect statistics on the existing table with <span style=" color: #528135;">NOSCAN</span>.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 157pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: left;">Explanation: When the NOSCAN option is specified, the command runs faster by ignoring file scanning but only collecting the number of files and their size</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">DESCRIBE EXTENDED </span>employee_partitioned PARTITION(year=2018, month=12);</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Check statistics in a partitioned table</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">DESCRIBE EXTENDED </span>employee_id;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Check statistics in a table</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s20" style="padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Output:</p><p class="s56" style="padding-left: 117pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 154%;text-align: left;">Detailed Table Information | Table(tableName:employee_id, dbName:default, owner:root, createTime:1653886189, lastAccessTime:0, retention:0, sd:StorageDescriptor(cols:[FieldSchema(name:name, type:string, comment:null), FieldSchema(name:employee_id, type:int, comment:null), FieldSchema(name:work_place, type:array&lt;string&gt;, comment:null), FieldSchema(name:gender_age, type:struct&lt;gender:string,age:int&gt;, comment:null), FieldSchema(name:skills_score, type:map&lt;string,int&gt;, comment:null), FieldSchema(name:depart_title</p><p class="s59" style="padding-left: 117pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">…</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">DESCRIBE FORMATTED </span>employee.name;</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Check statistics of a specific column</p></li><li data-list-text="8."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 89pt;text-indent: -17pt;text-align: left;">Logs</h3><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Logs provide detailed information to find out how a query/job runs. By checking the log details, we can identify runtime problems and issues that may cause bad performance.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s34" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">GIT CLONE <span style=" color: #404040;">folder structure</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s60" style="padding-top: 12pt;padding-left: 48pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">D:</p><p class="s61" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 48pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">└─── <span class="s60">docker-hive</span></p><p class="s60" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 58pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">│ .gitignore</p><p class="s60" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 58pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">│  <span class="s62">…</span></p><p class="s60" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 58pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">│ saa.txt</p><p class="s60" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 58pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">│ startup.sh</p><p class="s60" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 58pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">│  <span class="s62">…</span></p><p class="s61" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 55pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">└─── <span class="s60">conf</span></p><p class="s63" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 101pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">…</p><p style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 97pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span class="s64" style=" background-color: #E1EED9;"> hive-log4j2.properties</span></p><p style="padding-left: 141pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The system log contains the Hive running status and issues. It is configured in</p><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">{HIVE_HOME}/conf/hive-log4j.properties.</p><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">The following three lines of the log properties can be found in the file</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s50" style="text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 167%;text-align: left;">hive.root.logger=<span style=" color: #2D74B5;">WARN,DRFA </span>hive.log.dir=/<span style=" color: #2D74B5;">tmp/${user.name}</span></p><p class="s50" style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">hive.log.file=<span style=" color: #2D74B5;">hive.log</span></p><p style="padding-left: 2pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #2D74B5; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11.5pt;">--set logger level</span></p><p style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 1pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #2D74B5; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11.5pt;">--set log file path</span></p><p style="padding-top: 7pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #2D74B5; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11.5pt;">--set log file name</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s50" style="padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">--hiveconf <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">hive.root.logger</span>=<span style=" color: #2D74B5;">DEBUG,console</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">To modify the logger level, we can either modify the preceding property file that applies to all users, or set a Hive command-line config that only applies to the current user session,</p></li><li data-list-text="9."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 88pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Mask and encryption</h3><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">For sensitive and legally protected data, such as Confidential Information.it is necessary to store data in encrypted or masked format in the filesystem.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Using <span style=" color: #528135;">HASH </span>function.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">SELECT </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">name,</span></p><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 54pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10.5pt;">-- 128 bit</span></p><p style="padding-top: 6pt;padding-left: 54pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">md5(name) </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">as </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">md5_name,</span></p><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 54pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10.5pt;">-- 1G0 bit</span></p><p style="padding-top: 6pt;padding-left: 54pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">sha1(name) </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">as </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">sha1_name,</span></p><p style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 54pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10.5pt;">-- 25G bit</span></p><p style="padding-top: 6pt;padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 26pt;line-height: 155%;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">sha2(name, </span><span style=" color: #666; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">25G</span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">) </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">as </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">sha2_name </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">FROM </span><span style=" color: #333; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">employee_id;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p class="s20" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Output:</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><table style="height:26pt"><td style="width:66pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#BEBEBE;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#BEBEBE;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#BEBEBE;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#BEBEBE"><p style="width:97pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#BEBEBE;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#BEBEBE;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#BEBEBE;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#BEBEBE"><p class="s47" style="padding-left: 15pt;padding-right: 15pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 24pt;text-align: center;">c5c <span class="s65">... </span>25b</p></td><td style="width:94pt;border-top-style:solid;border-top-width:1pt;border-top-color:#BEBEBE;border-left-style:solid;border-left-width:1pt;border-left-color:#BEBEBE;border-bottom-style:solid;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-bottom-color:#BEBEBE;border-right-style:solid;border-right-width:1pt;border-right-color:#BEBEBE"><p class="s47" style="padding-left: 13pt;padding-right: 13pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 24pt;text-align: center;">a3f <span class="s65">... </span>c4f</p></td></tr></table><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s39" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 78pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Execution Time: (0.1211 seconds)</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-left: 153pt;text-indent: -58pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: left;">Explanation: The hashed value is quite often used to secure columns, which are the unique identifiers for joining or comparing data. Built-in function, such as md5(...), sha1(...), and sha2(...), can be used for data hashing in HQL.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 11pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Masking data is quite often requested for user-sensitive data such as:</p><ol id="l14"><li data-list-text="1."><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 8pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">Credit card numbers</p></li><li data-list-text="2."><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">Bank account numbers</p></li><li data-list-text="3."><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">Passwords and much more.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Different from the hash function, the mask function in SQL can specify masking on partial data, which makes it more flexible when you want to keep part of the data unmasked for better understanding.</p><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Using <span style=" color: #528135;">MASK </span>function</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">SELECT</span></p><p style="padding-top: 1pt;padding-left: 42pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #408080; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10.5pt;">-- big letter to U, small letter to l, number to</span></p><p style="padding-top: class="s39" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 78pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: center;">Execution Time: (0.321 seconds)</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s16" style="padding-left: 99pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 112%;text-align: justify;">Explanation: Different from the hash function, the mask function in SQL can specify masking on partial data, which makes it more flexible when you want to keep part of the data unmasked for better understanding.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Since Hive version of 1.3.0, aes_encrypt(input string/binary, key string/binary) and aes_decrypt(input binary, key string/binary) UDF have been provided to support data encryption and decryption.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: justify;">Using <span style=" color: #528135;">ENCRYPTION, DECRYPTION </span>function</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s38" style="padding-left: 27pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">SELECT </span>name, aes_encrypt(name,&#39;12345G78U012345G&#39;) <span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">as encrypted, </span>aes_decrypt(aes_encrypt(name,&#39;12345G78U012345G&#39;), &#39;12345G78U012345G&#39;<span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">) as decrypted FROM </span>employee_id<span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">;</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/><p style="text-indent: style="padding-left: 94pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Execution Time: (0.822 seconds)</p></li></ol></li><li data-list-text="10."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 96pt;text-indent: -24pt;text-align: left;">Hivemall</h3><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 14pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><a href="https://hivemall.incubator.apache.org/" style=" color: #404040; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;" target="_blank">Apache Hivemall (</a><span style=" color: #0462C1; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; font-size: 11pt;">https:/hivemall.incubator.apache.org/</span>) is a collection of Hive UDFs for machine learning.</p><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">It contains several ML algorithm implementations across classification, regression, recommendations, loss functions, and feature engineering, all as UDFs.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s17" style="padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">This allows end users to use SQL and only SQL to apply machine learning algorithms to a large volume of training data.</p><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Perform the following steps to set it up.</p><ol id="l15"><li data-list-text="1."><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 10pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: -18pt;line-height: 151%;text-align: left;"><a href="https://hivemall.incubator.apache.org/download.htmld" style=" color: #404040; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;" target="_blank">Download Hivemall from (</a><span style=" color: #0462C1; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; font-size: 11pt;">https://hivemall.incubator.apache.org/download.html</span>)</p><p style="padding-top: 9pt;padding-left: 63pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">docker cp </span><span style=" color: #2D74B5; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 12pt;">hivemall-all-xxx.jar </span><span style=" color: #008000; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">docker-hive_hive-server_1:/</span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 11pt;">home</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/></li><li data-list-text="2."><p style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">Copy the downloaded file from local computer and pasting it to HIVE container.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: style="padding-top: 7pt;padding-left: 63pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">hdfs fs -put <span style=" color: #2D74B5;">hivemall-all-xxx.jar /apps/hivemall</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"/></li><li data-list-text="3."><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align: left;">Putting the downloaded file inside <span style=" color: #528135;">HDFS.</span></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p></li><li data-list-text="4."><p class="s17" style="padding-top: 5pt;padding-left: 109pt;text-indent: <span class="s73">Verify the functions are created</span><span class="s74">.</span></p><h2 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 72pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">Working With Big Data</h2><ol exec </span><span style=" color: #006FC0; font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: none; font-size: 10pt;">hive-server bash</span></p><p left;">Explanation: Now we can create tables of CSV file and can analyse the data.</p></li><li data-list-text="2."><h3 style="padding-top: 4pt;padding-left: 88pt;text-indent: -16pt;text-align: left;">Creating Tables of Flights Dataset</h3><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 5pt;padding-left: 50pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 156%;text-align: left;">FL_DATE <span style=" color: #008000;">string</span>, OP_CARRIER string, OP_CARRIER_FL_NUM <span style=" color: style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, CRS_ARR_TIME <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, ARR_TIME <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, ARR_DELAY <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, CANCELLED <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, CANCELLATION_CODE string, DIVERTED <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, CRS_ELAPSED_TIME <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, ACTUAL_ELAPSED_TIME <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, AIR_TIME <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, DISTANCE <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>, CARRIER_DELAY <span style=" LATE_AIRCRAFT_DELAY <span style=" color: #008000;">int</span>)</p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 37pt;text-indent: 0pt;line-height: 10pt;text-align: left;">COMMENT <span style=" color: 0pt;line-height: 110%;text-align: justify;">Use case: United States government decides to analyse their domestic airline services data, to improve its airlines. Currently, US has data of all airlines from 2009 to 2018. US wants to find loopholes in their flights.</p><p style="text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;"><br/></p><p class="s29" style="padding-left: 29pt;text-indent: 0pt;text-align: left;">select</p><p
